title: Imaginary Portrait of Goya
provenance_text:
Antonio Saura [1930-1998], Madrid, Spain; Pierre Matisse Gallery, New York, NY, until February 1965 [1]; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1965 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 216 (illustrated in the catalogue) in "The 1964 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1964 - January 1965. It was lent by Pierre Matisse Gallery, New York, NY. The painting received one of two painting awards given at the exhibition.
[2]. The painting was purchased by Carnegie Institute from the 1964 International using the John Henry Craner Fund. Payment to Pierre Matisse Gallery was sent on February 17, 1965. The painting was accessioned later, on May 11, 1965.
